instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were employed in the related study for identifying different species of bolete mushrooms?

instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the performance of the models in the related study for identifying different species of bolete mushrooms, and how accurate were the results?

instruction: How did the researchers evaluate the performance of the different machine learning models used in the study on bolete species identification?
Output: The researchers evaluated the performance of the different machine learning models used in the study on bolete species identification by comparing the modeling results of partial least squares discrimination analysis (PLS-DA), support vector machines (SVM), and residual neural network (ResNet). They carried out different data pretreatment for the Fourier transform near infrared (FT-NIR) spectra and assessed the accuracy of each model. The accuracy of the PLS-DA model after spectral pretreatment was improved to 99.63% and 97.38% respectively. The accuracy of the SVM model after pretreatment was reduced to 98.5% and 93.63% to avoid overfitting. The ResNet model, which was established based on the original spectrum, achieved an accuracy of 100% without overfitting. Based on these results, the researchers concluded that the ResNet model was the best model for bolete species identification.
